channel.title: Chris Allum Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content on Chris Allum Portfolio

item.title: Fully Autonomous Rover
item.description: Overview With a team of 5 other Olin students, I helped built a fully autonomous rover that was capable of driving around campus.

item.title: Rock Paper Scissors CNN Machine Learning Model
item.description: In this project, I built a CNN machine learning model to identify hand poses in a game of rock paper scissors using PyTorch.

item.title: Rocky: Stabilization of an Wheeled Inverted Pendulum
item.description: In this project, I helped design and implement a control system that maintains the balance of a wheeled inverted pendulum and corrects for angular disturbance.

item.title: Baja SAE
item.description: Overview I have been a member of Olin’s Baja SAE team since my freshman year.

item.title: Dynamics Simulations
item.description: This is a collection of problem sets and my simulated results from my Olin 2021 Dynamics Class.

item.title: Object Recognition: Hot Dog or Not
item.description: In this project, I created an algorithm that attempted to identify whether an image was a hot dog or not.

item.title: Python Platformer Game
item.description: This is a two-player platformer game that I wrote in Python using Pygame.

item.title: Robotic Path Planning
item.description: In this project, I programed a Neato vacuuming robot to traverse an obstacle course.

item.title: High School Robotics
item.description: I was the head of my HS robotics team during my Junior and Senior years.

item.title: Bio Inspired Hopper
item.description: For this project, I designed a “hopper” using a set of limited materials.

item.title: Honda Robotics Internship
item.description: I worked as a robotics intern at Honda Development and Manufacturing of America, specifically at the Alabama Automotive Plant.
